p: The Glomeraceae were a specific indicator for invaded plots in semi-natural grassland. Subsequently, we also found a significant increase of SOM in these invaded plots. As AMF-derived carbon in itself may be a significant component of SOM [ 57, 58], it also has been suggested that AMF symbiosis increases soil C by reducing the decomposition of SOM [ 59]. Moreover, AMF could also alter SOM by affecting other saprobic soil microbiota [ 13]. Unfortunately, no sequencing data from the bacterial community were available to investigate this in more detail.
